text: hi my name is yob tasek and I'm the
engineering director at Kabam robotics
we are based in Singapore and specialize
in delivering Cutting Edge robots and
connectivity Solutions our robots are
deployed across four continents in the
commercial security facility management
and Hospitality operations with me here
is collab our indoor security robot
equipped with Advanced video analytics
functions from the start we recognized
the need for adaptable infrastructure
for robot operations so we embarked on a
journey to create Smart Plus a
cloud-based robot management platform
besides leveraging the AWS startup
activate program which supported us with
technology advisory and credits AWS
Engineers work closely with our team to
optimize our architecture and resource
use and today smartass is really pivotal
it has transformed our robot systems
management ensuring the top- notch
reliability security and performance to
meet the evolving customer needs as part
of our quest to enhance the capabilities
of our robots we created Remy Remy is a
groundbreaking system equipping our
robots with the power of large language
models users are able to speak to the
robot and the robot understands their
requests Remy doesn't stop at
understanding though it can device
action plans for the robot enabling it
to execute tasks like navigation docking
vocal communication image retrieval and
sending email to fulfill the users
request at the heart of Remy lies CLA 2
a robust large language model built by
anthropic and seamlessly integrated
using Amazon Bedrock API to comprehend
the robot's environment through camera
feeds we've Incorporated lava a
multimodel language Vision assistant
built on open source llama 2 which we
deployed using Amazon Sage maker
additionally we leveraged our existing
services such as Amazon eks for our
Cloud API and Amazon poly the text to
voice service for robot announcements to
further enhance the overall
functionality of our robots Amazon
Bedrock enabled us to experiment quickly
with different large language models to
find the right fit and with Amazon's sag
maker we were able to deploy open source
model lava with e at the tenth of the
cost of maintaining our own hardware and
productizing the models we benefited
from the technical support and
consultation of on gen AI from the AWS
team we managed to do this with just two
Engineers dedicated to the project our
customers have already started to see
the impact of Remy on their operations
for example in retail sector Remy can
help guide customers to the products
they are looking for and answer
questions in real time and this enhances
the overall user experience and makes
our robot more approachable and user
friendly kids just love it and people
generally have more fun around them
Remis versatility opens up new use cases
for collab from assisting with user
information to responding to emergencies
and we are already working on the second
version of Remy in which the whole
application will be deployed on cloud we
intent to integrate services like Amazon
transcribe for speech to text or Amazon
recognition for pH and object detection
our aim is for Remy to be able to detect
eye contact and automatically infer
whether someone is talking to it and
make it more natural experience for
users we are looking to use Amazon
sagemaker to fine-tune our models and
host additional open source models that
could be integrated with Remy we also
plan to evaluate AWS wavelength that
provides 5G compute infrastructure for
some of our industrial customers Remy
powered by AWS represents a significant
Leap Forward in the k abilities of our
robots and the services we provide to
our customers with AWS Kabam robotics is
staying at the Forefront of the service
robotics industry delivering the
innovative solutions that have a real
and positive impact on our customers we
look forward to Future collaboration
with AWS for more exciting developments
in the field of Robotics and Cloud
technology
